author: Staff Reporter
text:
V.B. Christinayagam (46), a real estate dealer from Kundadam block, petitioned District Collector S. Jayandhi seeking intervention of the district administration into his complaints pertaining to family properties, and death of his mother.

He told reporters that the police did not conduct any proper inquiry into 33 petitions given at Kundadam Police Station on various matters including the suspicious death of his mother.

“Since the death of my mother in May, 2014, some of her kin have taken possession of the family properties which remains in the name of my mother and father, who died much before,” he said.

According to him, some of the close family members have taken custody of Rs 75 lakh, and 40 acres without giving him a share.

“Every time I gave complaints, the police carry out some cosmetic inquiries, and never heard my version in full.”

He said that the district administration had now promised to ask the police to look afresh into the issue.
title: Complaint against police inaction
